attributes.action: Stop Condemning Any Petition About E-Petitions To The Rejected Pile!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: So, we can't complain about the rubbish that people "petition" about, because "e-petition is not the appropriate channel." Right.  BTW, I’m not "intending to be humorous."  I am aghast at the things which appear here.  “Wine in restaurants costs me more"; "this kids sweater is scratchy;" my burger doesn't look like the one in the picture". Oh yes - "MFI sell rubbish kitchens."  I'm not talking about the ill-informed, aggressive views that many people seem to have - usually ending with "let's put the Great back in Great Britain" - but the aimless whining. I have attempted three petitions - all rejected. Daily Mail readers have their views accepted no problemo - asylum seekers, single parents, such easy targets, aren’t they? Finally…if this is rejected because “there is an identical petition” there isn’t because I’ve checked! And yes, I am requesting action! Bet you a fiver this is rejected - again! p.s. - this was initially rejected for being "intemperate". Compared to the hate-filled petitions that are accepted? Get a grip!

rejection.details: We do not accept petitions about the petitions system. All feedback about the petitions system should be sent to team@petitions.pm.gov.uk
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
